resource.title: 1000 Genomes Browser
resource.shortDesc: Interactive graphical display of 1000 Genomes Project Data
resource.longDesc: An interactive graphical viewer that allows users to explore variant calls, genotype calls and supporting evidence (such as aligned sequence reads) that have been produced by the 1000 Genomes Project.

resource.title: Amino Acid Explorer
resource.shortDesc: Interactive tool about amino acids and their properties and functions
resource.longDesc: This tool allows users to explore the characteristics of amino acids by comparing their structural and chemical properties, predicting protein sequence changes caused by mutations, viewing common substitutions, and browsing the functions of given residues in conserved domains.

resource.title: ASN.1 Format Summary
resource.shortDesc: Specifications of the ASN.1 data format used by NCBI
resource.longDesc: An International Standards Organization (ISO) data representation format used to achieve interoperability between platforms. For data specifications and conversion tools, see NCBI Data Specification below.

resource.title: Assembly Archive
resource.shortDesc: Displays submitted assemblies of trace sequences
resource.longDesc: Links the raw sequence information found in the Trace Archive with assembly information found in publicly available sequence repositories (GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ). The Assembly Viewer allows a user to see the multiple sequence alignments as well as the actual sequence chromatogram.

resource.title: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (BLAST)
resource.shortDesc: Tool for finding local regions of sequence similarity
resource.longDesc: Finds regions of local similarity between biological sequences. The program compares nucleotide or protein sequences to sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches. BLAST can be used to infer functional and evolutionary relationships between sequences as well as to help identify members of gene families.

resource.title: Batch Entrez
resource.shortDesc: Retrieve sequence records from a file of identifiers.
resource.longDesc: Allows you to retrieve records from many Entrez databases by uploading a file of GI or accession numbers from the Nucleotide or Protein databases, or a file of unique identifiers from other Entrez databases. Search results can be saved in various formats directly to a local file on your computer.

resource.title: BioAssay Services
resource.shortDesc: Tools for summarizing bioactivities and structure-activity relationships
resource.longDesc: Tools that summarize the biological test results in the PubChem database and provide alternative ways to view bioassay results and structure-activity relationships. Users also can download their analyses and data tables.

resource.title: BioProject (formerly Genome Project)
resource.shortDesc: Genomics, functional genomics, and genetics studies & links to corresponding data
resource.longDesc: A collection of genomics, functional genomics, and genetics studies and links to their resulting datasets. This resource describes project scope, material, and objectives and provides a mechanism to retrieve datasets that are often difficult to find due to inconsistent annotation, multiple independent submissions, and the varied nature of diverse data types which are often stored in different databases.

resource.title: BioProject Submission
resource.shortDesc: Register BioProject studies
resource.longDesc: An online form that provides an interface for researchers, consortia and organizations to register their BioProjects. This serves as the starting point for the submission of genomic and genetic data for the study. The data does not need to be submitted at the time of BioProject registration.

resource.title: BioSample
resource.shortDesc: Biosamples - source materials used in experimental assays.
resource.longDesc: The BioSample database contains descriptions of biological source materials used in experimental assays.

resource.title: BioSystems
resource.shortDesc: Database that groups biomedical literature, small molecules, and sequence data in terms of biological relationships.
resource.longDesc: Database that groups biomedical literature, small molecules, and sequence data in terms of biological relationships.

resource.title: BLAST (Stand-alone)
resource.shortDesc: BLAST programs for a local computer
resource.longDesc: BLAST executables for local use are provided for Solaris, LINUX, Windows, and MacOSX systems. See the README file in the ftp directory for more information. Pre-formatted databases for BLAST nucleotide, protein, and translated searches also are available for downloading under the db subdirectory.

resource.title: BLAST Link (BLink)
resource.shortDesc: Pre-computed reports showing proteins with similar sequences
resource.longDesc: A link option on protein records that displays the results of a pre-computed BLAST search of that protein against all other protein sequences at NCBI.

resource.title: BLAST Microbial Genomes
resource.shortDesc: Finds similar sequences within microbial genomes
resource.longDesc: Performs a BLAST search for similar sequences from selected complete eukaryotic and prokaryotic genomes.

resource.title: BLAST RefSeqGene
resource.shortDesc: Finds similar sequences within the RefSeqGene/LRG dataset.
resource.longDesc: Performs a BLAST search of the genomic sequences in the RefSeqGene/LRG set. The default display provides ready navigation to review alignments in the Graphics display.

resource.title: BLAST Tutorials and Guides
resource.shortDesc: Variety of documents describing NCBI BLAST services
resource.longDesc: This page links to a number of BLAST-related tutorials and guides, including a selection guide for BLAST algorithms, descriptions of BLAST output formats, explanations of the parameters for stand-alone BLAST, directions for setting up stand-alone BLAST on local machines and using the BLAST URL API.

resource.title: Bookshelf
resource.shortDesc: Online books and reports
resource.longDesc: A collection of biomedical books that can be searched directly or from linked data in other NCBI databases. The collection includes biomedical textbooks, other scientific titles, genetic resources such as GeneReviews, and NCBI help manuals.

resource.title: CDTree
resource.shortDesc: Program for viewing, updating and creating protein domains and hierarchies
resource.longDesc: A stand-alone application for classifying protein sequences and investigating their evolutionary relationships. CDTree can import, analyze and update existing Conserved Domain (CDD) records and hierarchies, and also allows users to create their own. CDTree is tightly integrated with Entrez CDD and Cn3D, and allows users to create and update protein domain alignments.

resource.title: ClinVar
resource.shortDesc: ClinVar aggregates information about sequence variation and its relationship to human health.
resource.longDesc: A resource under development to provide a public, tracked record of reported relationships among human variation and observed health status. ClinVar has a projected launch date for late 2011.

resource.title: CloneDB (formerly Clone Registry)
resource.shortDesc: Information about genomic clones and libraries.
resource.longDesc: A database that integrates information about clones and libraries, including sequence data, map positions and distributor information.

resource.title: Cn3D
resource.shortDesc: Program for viewing 3D structures and alignments
resource.longDesc: A stand-alone application for viewing 3-dimensional structures from NCBI's Entrez retrieval service. Cn3D runs on Windows, Macintosh, and UNIX and can be configured to receive data from most popular web browsers. Cn3D simultaneously displays structure, sequence, and alignment, and has powerful annotation and alignment editing features.

resource.title: COBALT
resource.shortDesc: Protein multiple sequence alignment tool
resource.longDesc: COBALT is a protein multiple sequence alignment tool that finds a collection of pairwise constraints derived from conserved domain database, protein motif database, and sequence similarity, using RPS-BLAST, BLASTP, and PHI-BLAST.

resource.title: Coffee Break
resource.shortDesc: Short reports on recent biological discoveries that demonstrate use of NCBI tools
resource.longDesc: Part of the NCBI Bookshelf, Coffee Break combines reports on recent biomedical discoveries with use of NCBI tools. Each report incorporates interactive tutorials that show how NCBI bioinformatics tools are used as a part of the research process.

resource.title: Computational Resources from NCBI's Structure Group
resource.shortDesc: Computational Resources from NCBI's Structure Group
resource.longDesc: A centralized page providing access and links to resources developed by the Structure Group of the NCBI Computational Biology Branch (CBB). These resources cover databases and tools to help in the study of macromolecular structures, conserved domains and protein classification, small molecules and their biological activity, and biological pathways and systems.

resource.title: Concise Microbial Protein BLAST
resource.shortDesc: BLAST against the Protein Clusters database
resource.longDesc: A specialized BLAST service in which the queried database consists of all proteins from complete microbial (prokaryotic) genomes. NCBI has precalculated clusters of similar proteins at the genus-level and one representative is chosen from each cluster in order to reduce the dataset, thereby reducing search time and providing a broader taxonomic view.

resource.title: Consensus CDS (CCDS)
resource.shortDesc: Collaborative effort to provide standard annotations for human and mouse genes
resource.longDesc: A collaborative effort to identify a core set of human and mouse protein coding regions that are consistently annotated and of high quality.

resource.title: Conserved Domain Architecture Retrieval Tool (CDART)
resource.shortDesc: Tool that displays and retrieves proteins according to their domain architecture
resource.longDesc: Displays the functional domains that make up a given protein sequence. It lists proteins with similar domain architectures and can retrieve proteins that contain particular combinations of domains.

resource.title: Conserved Domain Database (CDD)
resource.shortDesc: Database of conserved protein domains represented by multiple sequence alignments
resource.longDesc: A collection of sequence alignments and profiles representing protein domains conserved in molecular evolution. It also includes alignments of the domains to known 3-dimensional protein structures in the MMDB database.

resource.title: Conserved Domain Search Service (CD Search)
resource.shortDesc: Locates conserved domains within a protein sequence
resource.longDesc: Identifies the conserved domains present in a protein sequence. CD-Search uses RPS-BLAST (Reverse Position-Specific BLAST) to compare a query sequence against position-specific score matrices that have been prepared from conserved domain alignments present in the Conserved Domain Database (CDD).

resource.title: Database of Expressed Sequence Tags (dbEST)
resource.shortDesc: Expressed sequence tags in GenBank
resource.longDesc: A divison of GenBank that contains short single-pass reads of cDNA (transcript) sequences. dbEST can be searched directly through the Nucleotide EST Database.

resource.title: Database of Genome Survey Sequences (dbGSS)
resource.shortDesc: Genome survey sequences in GenBank
resource.longDesc: A division of GenBank that contains short single-pass reads of genomic DNA. dbGSS can be searched directly through the Nucleotide GSS Database.

resource.title: Database of Genomic Structural Variation (dbVar)
resource.shortDesc: A database of genomic structural variation
resource.longDesc: The dbVar database has been developed to archive information associated with large scale genomic variation, including large insertions, deletions, translocations and inversions. In addition to archiving variation discovery, dbVar also stores associations of defined variants with phenotype information.

resource.title: Database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) Data Submission Policies
resource.shortDesc: Policies and procedures for submitting data to dbGaP
resource.longDesc: Guidelines and requirements for submitting genotype and phenotype association data to dbGaP.

resource.title: Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP)
resource.shortDesc: Genotype/Phenotype association studies
resource.longDesc: An archive and distribution center for the description and results of studies which investigate the interaction of genotype and phenotype. These studies include genome-wide association (GWAS), medical resequencing, molecular diagnostic assays, as well as association between genotype and non-clinical traits.

resource.title: Database of Major Histocompatibility Complex (dbMHC)
resource.shortDesc: Data related to the human major histocompatibility complex
resource.longDesc: An open, publicly accessible platform where the HLA community can submit, edit, view, and exchange data related to the human major histocompatibility complex. It consists of an interactive Alignment Viewer for HLA and related genes, an MHC microsatellite database, a sequence interpretation site for Sequencing Based Typing (SBT), and a Primer/Probe database.

resource.title: Database of Major Histocompatibility Complex (dbMHC) Microsatellite Markers Submission Template
resource.shortDesc: Guidelines and template for submitting MHC region microsatellite data to dbMHC.
resource.longDesc: Guidelines and template for submitting MHC region microsatellite data to dbMHC.

resource.title: Database of Short Genetic Variations (dbSNP)
resource.shortDesc: Database of short nucleotide sequence variations.
resource.longDesc: Includes single nucleotide variations, microsatellites, and small-scale insertions and deletions. dbSNP contains population-specific frequency and genotype data, experimental conditions, molecular context, and mapping information for both neutral variations and clinical mutations.

resource.title: Digital Differential Display (DDD)
resource.shortDesc: Tool to compare gene expression levels based on EST data in UniGene
resource.longDesc: A tool for comparing EST profiles in order to identify genes with significantly different expression levels.

resource.title: E-Bench
resource.shortDesc: Aid for building E-utility URLs and viewing their output
resource.longDesc: This interactive tool allows users to build E-utility URLs, either from a form or by hand, and then view their raw output. The tool provides a simple environment for testing E-utility URLs before including them in applications.

resource.title: E-Utilities
resource.shortDesc: URL application programming interface for searching, linking and downloading data within NCBI's Entrez system
resource.longDesc: Tools that provide access to data within NCBI's Entrez system outside of the regular web query interface. They provide a method of automating Entrez tasks within software applications. Each utility performs a specialized retrieval task, and can be used simply by writing a specially formatted URL.

resource.title: Ebot
resource.shortDesc: Builds custom Perl scripts that execute E-utility pipelines
resource.longDesc: A tool that allows users to construct an E-utility analysis pipeline using an online form, and then generates a Perl script to execute the pipeline.

resource.title: Electronic PCR (e-PCR)
resource.shortDesc: Tool for identifying sequence tagged sites in a DNA sequence
resource.longDesc: A computational procedure that is used to identify sequence tagged sites (STSs) within DNA sequences. e-PCR looks for potential STSs in DNA sequences by searching for subsequences that closely match the PCR primers and have the correct order, orientation, and spacing that could represent the PCR primers used to generate known STSs.

resource.title: Epigenomics
resource.shortDesc: Genomic maps of stable, inheritable epigenetic features
resource.longDesc: This resource enables users to explore and visualize richly-annotated epigenomics datasets. It provides a unique interface to search and navigate epigenomic data in the context of biological sample information, as well as tools to select, download and view multiple sets of epigenomic data as tracks on genome browsers.

resource.title: Frequency-weighted Link (FLink)
resource.shortDesc: FLink provides frequency-weighted links between records in select Entrez databases
resource.longDesc: FLink is a tool that enables you to link from a group of records in a source database to a ranked list of associated records in a destination database based on frequency-weighted statistics.

resource.title: FTP: BLAST Databases
resource.shortDesc: Databases for stand-alone BLAST
resource.longDesc: Sequence databases for use with the stand-alone BLAST programs. The files in this directory are pre-formatted databases that are ready to use with BLAST.

resource.title: FTP: CDD
resource.shortDesc: Download a database of conserved protein domains represented by multiple sequence alignments
resource.longDesc: This site provides full data records for CDD, along with individual Position Specific Scoring Matrices (PSSMs), mFASTA sequences and annotation data for each conserved domain. See the README file for full details.

resource.title: FTP: dbGAP Open-Access Data
resource.shortDesc: Publicly available sections of genotype/phenotype association studies
resource.longDesc: Open-access data generally include summaries of genotype/phenotype association studies, descriptions of the measured variables, and study documents, such as the protocol and questionnaires. Access to individual-level data, including phenotypic data tables and genotypes, requires varying levels of authorization.

resource.title: FTP: dbMHC Data
resource.shortDesc: Download data related to the human major histocompatibility complex
resource.longDesc: This site contains data in separate directories for the various projects and resources within the database of human major histocompatibility (dbMHC).

resource.title: FTP: FASTA BLAST Databases
resource.shortDesc: BLAST databases in FASTA format
resource.longDesc: Sequence databases in FASTA format for use with the stand-alone BLAST programs. These databases must be formatted using formatdb before they can be used with BLAST.

resource.title: FTP: GenBank
resource.shortDesc: Database of submitted nucleotide sequences
resource.longDesc: This site contains files for all sequence records in GenBank in the default flat file format. The files are organized by GenBank division, and the full contents are described in the README.genbank file.

resource.title: FTP: Gene
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable database of gene loci and associated transcripts and proteins
resource.longDesc: This site contains three directories: DATA, GeneRIF and tools. The DATA directory contains files listing all data linked to GeneIDs along with subdirectories containing ASN.1 data for the Gene records. The GeneRIF (Gene References into Function) directory contains PubMed identifiers for articles describing the function of a single gene or interactions between products of two genes. Sample programs for manipulating gene data are provided in the tools directory. Please see the README file for details.

resource.title: FTP: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Profiles and Datasets
resource.shortDesc: Database of gene expression profiles and datasets
resource.longDesc: This site contains GEO data in two formats: SOFT (Simple Omnibus in Text Format) and MINiML (MIAME Notation in Markup Language). Summary text files and supplementary data are also available. Please see the README.TXT file for more information.

resource.title: FTP: Genome
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable database of curated genomic DNA sequences
resource.longDesc: This site contains genome sequence and mapping data for organisms in Entrez Genome. The data are organized in directories for single species or groups of species. Mapping data are collected in the directory MapView and are organized by species. See the README file in the root directory and the README files in the species subdirectories for detailed information.

resource.title: FTP: Genome Mapping Data
resource.shortDesc: Mapping data underlying the NCBI Map Viewer
resource.longDesc: Contains directories for each genome that include available mapping data for current and previous builds of that genome.

resource.title: FTP: Genome Markers (UniSTS)
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable database of Sequence Tagged Sites
resource.longDesc: This directory contains text and XML files for UniSTS records along with mapping data.

resource.title: FTP: GenPept
resource.shortDesc: Conceptual translations of protein coding sequences in GenBank
resource.longDesc: The protein sequences corresponding to the translations of coding sequences (CDS) in GenBank are collected for each GenBank release..Please see the README file in the directory for more information.

resource.title: FTP: HomoloGene
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable sets of homologous eukaryotic genes
resource.longDesc: This site contains data for each build of HomoloGene, beginning with build 35. Complete data for each build are provided in XML, and a data summary is provided in tab-delimited text format.

resource.title: FTP: NCBI Field Guide Manual
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable material for NCBI's field guide.
resource.longDesc: Downloadable material for NCBI's previously offered Field Guide training course.

resource.title: FTP: NCBI Structure Course Materials
resource.shortDesc: Course materials covering NCBI structure and CDD resources
resource.longDesc: PowerPoint slides, handouts and exercises for the previously offered NCBI course "Exploring 3D Molecular Structures."

resource.title: FTP: NCBI Taxonomy
resource.shortDesc: Download the NCBI taxonomy tree
resource.longDesc: This site contains the full taxonomy database along with files associating nucleotide and protein sequence records with their taxonomy IDs. See the taxdump_readme.txt and gi_taxid.readme files for more information.

resource.title: FTP: Protein Clusters
resource.shortDesc: Download clusters of related proteins from prokaryotes and organelles
resource.longDesc: This site contains data from the Protein Clusters database arranged by release date. See the README files for more information.

resource.title: FTP: PubChem
resource.shortDesc: Contributed chemical substances, standardized chemical structures and bioactivity data
resource.longDesc: This site provides data from the PubChem Substance, Compound and Bioassay databases for download via ftp. Full downloads of the databases are available along with daily, weekly and monthly updates for Substance and Compound. Substance and Compound data are provided in ASN.1, SDF and XML formats. See the README files for more information.

resource.title: FTP: RefSeq
resource.shortDesc: Curated sequences produced by NCBI
resource.longDesc: This site contains all nucleotide and protein sequence records in the Reference Sequence (RefSeq) collection. The ""release"" directory contains the most current release of the complete collection, while data for selected organisms (such as human, mouse and rat) are available in separate directories. Data are available in FASTA and flat file formats. See the README file for details.

resource.title: FTP: Sequence Read Archive (SRA) Download Facility
resource.shortDesc: Short reads derived from next-generation sequencing
resource.longDesc: This site contains next-generation sequencing data organized by the submitted sequencing project.

resource.title: FTP: Site
resource.shortDesc: Site for downloading NCBI data and software
resource.longDesc: FTP download site for NCBI databases, tools, and utilities.

resource.title: FTP: SKY/M-Fish and CGH Data
resource.shortDesc: Download database of chromosomal aberrations in cancer
resource.longDesc: This site contains SKY-CGH data in ASN.1, XML and EasySKYCGH formats. See the skycghreadme.txt file for more information.

resource.title: FTP: SNP
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable data for SNP.
resource.longDesc: Downloadable data for SNP.

resource.title: FTP: Structure (MMDB)
resource.shortDesc: Download a database of 3D macromolecular structures derived from PDB
resource.longDesc: This site contains ASN.1 data for all records in MMDB along with VAST alignment data and the non-redundant PDB (nr-PDB) data sets. See the README file for more information.

resource.title: FTP: Trace Archive
resource.shortDesc: Download DNA chromatograms, base calls, and quality estimates for single-pass reads
resource.longDesc: This site contains the trace chromatogram data organized by species. Data include chromatogram, quality scores, FASTA sequences from automatic base calls, and other ancillary information in tab-delimited text as well as XML formats. See the README file for details.

resource.title: FTP: UniGene
resource.shortDesc: Downloadable gene-centered clusters of transcripts and ESTs
resource.longDesc: This site contains individual directories for each organism with data in UniGene. The data for each species includes the unique sequence for each UniGene cluster, all sequences in each cluster in FASTA format and library information for the cluster. See the README file for further details.

resource.title: FTP: UniVec
resource.shortDesc: Database used for detecting vector contamination
resource.longDesc: This site contains the UniVec and UniVec_Core databases in FASTA format. See the README.uv file for details.

resource.title: FTP: Whole Genome Shotgun Sequences
resource.shortDesc: Sequences from Whole Genome Shotgun sequencing projects
resource.longDesc: This site contains whole genome shotgun sequence data organized by the 4-digit project code. Data include GenBank and GenPept flat files, quality scores and summary statistics. See the README.genbank.wgs file for more information.

resource.title: GenBank
resource.shortDesc: DNA and RNA sequences submitted to NCBI
resource.longDesc: The NIH genetic sequence database, an annotated collection of all publicly available DNA sequences. GenBank is part of the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration, which comprises the DNA DataBank of Japan (DDBJ), the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL), and GenBank at NCBI. These three organizations exchange data on a daily basis. GenBank consists of several divisions, most of which can be accessed through the Nucleotide database. The exceptions are the EST and GSS divisions, which are accessed through the Nucleotide EST and Nucleotide GSS databases, respectively.

resource.title: GenBank: BankIt
resource.shortDesc: Web tool for simple submissions of nucleotide sequences
resource.longDesc: A web-based sequence submission tool for one or a few submissions to the GenBank database, designed to make the submission process quick and easy.

resource.title: GenBank: Barcode
resource.shortDesc: Tool to submit short nucleotide sequences used for species identification.
resource.longDesc: Tool for submission to the GenBank database of Barcode short nucleotide sequences from a standard genetic locus for use in species identification.

resource.title: GenBank: Sequin
resource.shortDesc: Software tool for complex submissions of nucleotide sequences
resource.longDesc: A stand-alone software tool developed by the NCBI for submitting and updating entries to public sequence databases (GenBank, EMBL, or DDBJ). It is capable of handling simple submissions that contain a single short mRNA sequence, complex submissions containing long sequences, multiple annotations, segmented sets of DNA, as well as sequences from phylogenetic and population studies with alignments. For simple submission, use the online submission tool BankIt instead.

resource.title: GenBank: tbl2asn
resource.shortDesc: Command-line program for submitting sequence data
resource.longDesc: A command-line program that automates the creation of sequence records for submission to GenBank using many of the same functions as Sequin. It is used primarily for submission of complete genomes and large batches of sequences.

resource.title: Gene
resource.shortDesc: Database of gene loci and associated transcripts and proteins
resource.longDesc: A searchable database of genes, focusing on genomes that have been completely sequenced and that have an active research community to contribute gene-specific data. Information includes nomenclature, chromosomal localization, gene products and their attributes (e.g., protein interactions), associated markers, phenotypes, interactions, and links to citations, sequences, variation details, maps, expression reports, homologs, protein domain content, and external databases.

resource.title: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) BLAST
resource.shortDesc: Tool to locate sequences on gene expression platforms using BLAST
resource.longDesc: Tool for aligning a query sequence (nucleotide or protein) to GenBank sequences included on microarray or SAGE platforms in the GEO database.

resource.title: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Database
resource.shortDesc: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Database
resource.longDesc: A public functional genomics data repository supporting MIAME-compliant data submissions. Array- and sequence-based data are accepted and tools are provided to help users query and download experiments and curated gene expression profiles.

resource.title: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Datasets
resource.shortDesc: Curated collections of gene expression data sets
resource.longDesc: Stores curated gene expression and molecular abundance DataSets assembled from the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) repository. DataSet records contain additional resources, including cluster tools and differential expression queries.

resource.title: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Profiles
resource.shortDesc: Database of gene expression Profiles for individual sequences
resource.longDesc: Stores individual gene expression and molecular abundance Profiles assembled from the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) repository. Search for specific profiles of interest based on gene annotation or pre-computed profile characteristics.

resource.title: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Web Deposit
resource.shortDesc: Online tool for submitting data to GEO
resource.longDesc: Submit expression data, such as microarray, SAGE or mass spectrometry datasets to the NCBI Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) database.

resource.title: Gene Plot
resource.shortDesc: Compares two prokaryotic genomes based on protein homologs
resource.longDesc: A tool for pairwise comparison of two prokaryotic genomes that displays pairs of protein homologs that are symmetrical best hits between the two genomes.

resource.title: GeneReviews
resource.shortDesc: Review articles for disease descriptions and genetic involvement.
resource.longDesc: A collection of expert-authored, peer-reviewed disease descriptions on the NCBI Bookshelf that apply genetic testing to the diagnosis, management, and genetic counseling of patients and families with specific inherited conditions.

resource.title: GeneRIF
resource.shortDesc: Annotate gene record with function/protein data and associated PubMed ID
resource.longDesc: GeneRIF provides a simple mechanism to allow scientists to add to the functional annotation of genes in the Gene database.

resource.title: Genes and Disease
resource.shortDesc: Articles about genetic disorders
resource.longDesc: Summaries of information for selected genetic disorders with discussions of the underlying mutation(s) and clinical features, as well as links to related databases and organizations.

resource.title: GeneTests
resource.shortDesc: Medical genetics testing information
resource.longDesc: A publicly funded medical genetics information resource developed for physicians, other healthcare providers, and researchers, available at no cost to all interested persons.

resource.title: Genetic Codes
resource.shortDesc: Finds the genetic translation code for a taxonomy node
resource.longDesc: Displays the genetic codes for organisms in the Taxonomy database in tables and on a taxonomic tree.

resource.title: Genetic Testing Registry (GTR)
resource.shortDesc: Medical genetics testing information
resource.longDesc: A voluntary registry of genetic tests and laboratories, with detailed information about the tests such as what is measured and analytic and clinical validity. GTR also is a nexus for information about genetic conditions and provides context-specific links to a variety of resources, including practice guidelines, published literature, and genetic data/information. The initial scope of GTR includes single gene tests for Mendelian disorders, as well as arrays, panels and pharmacogenetic tests.

resource.title: Genome
resource.shortDesc: Curated genomic DNA sequences
resource.longDesc: Contains sequence and map data from the whole genomes of over 1000 organisms. The genomes represent both completely sequenced organisms and those for which sequencing is in progress. All three main domains of life (bacteria, archaea, and eukaryota) are represented, as well as many viruses, phages, viroids, plasmids, and organelles.

resource.title: Genome BLAST
resource.shortDesc: Aligns sequences to a genomic assembly
resource.longDesc: This tool compares nucleotide or protein sequences to genomic sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches using the Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (BLAST) algorithm.

resource.title: Genome ProtMap
resource.shortDesc: Maps proteins from a COG/VOG back to its genome
resource.longDesc: Genome ProtMap maps each protein from a COG, or in the case of viruses a VOG, back to its genome, and displays all the genomic segments coding for members of this particular group of related proteins. The view can be shifted to focus on an adjacent COG/VOG, and clusters can be searched by name, protein gi, or gene locus tag.

resource.title: Genome Reference Consortium (GRC)
resource.shortDesc: Genome Reference Consortium (GRC): Tools and information for the human and mouse reference genomes.
resource.longDesc: The Genome Reference Consortium (GRC) maintains responsibility for the human and mouse reference genomes. Members consist of The Genome Center at Washington University, the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI) and the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI). The GRC works to correct misrepresented loci and to close remaining assembly gaps. In addition, the GRC seeks to provide alternate assemblies for complex or structurally variant genomic loci. At the GRC website (http://www.genomereference.org), the public can view genomic regions currently under review, report genome-related problems and contact the GRC.

resource.title: Genome Remapping Service
resource.shortDesc: NCBI Remap Tool
resource.longDesc: NCBI's Remap tool allows users to project annotation data and convert locations of features from one genomic assembly to another or to RefSeqGene sequences through a base by base analysis. Options are provided to adjust the stringency of remapping, and summary results are displayed on the web page. Full results can be downloaded for viewing in NCBI's Genome Workbench graphical viewer, and annotation data for the remapped features, as well as summary data, is also available for download.

resource.title: Genome Workbench
resource.shortDesc: Stand-alone application for analyzing sequence data
resource.longDesc: An integrated application for viewing and analyzing sequence data. With Genome Workbench, you can view data in publically available sequence databases at NCBI, and mix these data with your own data.

resource.title: HIV-1, Human Protein Interaction Database
resource.shortDesc: Summary of all known HIV-1 protein interactions.
resource.longDesc: A database of known interactions of HIV-1 proteins with proteins from human hosts. It provides annotated bibliographies of published reports of protein interactions, with links to the corresponding PubMed records and sequence data.

resource.title: HomoloGene
resource.shortDesc: Sets of homologous eukaryotic genes
resource.longDesc: A gene homology tool that compares nucleotide sequences between pairs of organisms in order to identify putative orthologs. Curated orthologs are incorporated from a variety of sources via the Gene database.

resource.title: Influenza Virus
resource.shortDesc: Data from the NIAID Influenza Genome Sequencing Project
resource.longDesc: A compilation of data from the NIAID Influenza Genome Sequencing Project and GenBank. It provides tools for flu sequence analysis, annotation and submission to GenBank. This resource also has links to other flu sequence resources, and publications and general information about flu viruses.

resource.title: Journals in NCBI Databases
resource.shortDesc: Information on journals cited by NCBI records
resource.longDesc: Subset of the NLM Catalog database providing information on journals that are referenced in NCBI database records, including PubMed abstracts. This subset can be searched using the journal title, MEDLINE or ISO abbreviation, ISSN, or the NLM Catalog ID.

resource.title: LinkOut
resource.shortDesc: Service to provide links from NCBI records to external resources.
resource.longDesc: A service that allows third parties to link directly from PubMed and other Entrez database records to relevant web-accessible resources beyond the Entrez system. Examples of LinkOut resources include full-text publications, biological databases, consumer health information and research tools.

resource.title: Map Viewer
resource.shortDesc: Tool for searching, viewing and downloading genomic maps and related data
resource.longDesc: Provides special browsing capabilities of maps and assembled sequences for a subset of organisms. You can view and search an organism's complete genome, display maps, and zoom into progressively greater levels of detail, down to the sequence data for a region of interest.

resource.title: MEDLINE (Leasing)
resource.shortDesc: Obtain a lease to download PubMed from the National Library of Medicine
resource.longDesc: NLM leases MEDLINE/PubMed to U.S. individuals or organizations.

resource.title: MeSH Database
resource.shortDesc: Controlled vocabulary for MEDLINE
resource.longDesc: MeSH (Medical Subject Headings) is the U.S. National Library of Medicine's controlled vocabulary for indexing articles for MEDLINE/PubMed. MeSH terminology provides a consistent way to retrieve information that may use different terminology for the same concepts.

resource.title: National Library of Medicine (NLM) Catalog
resource.shortDesc: Catalog of the complete holdings of the National Library of Medicine
resource.longDesc: Bibliographic data for all the journals, books, audiovisuals, computer software, electronic resources and other materials that are in the library's holdings.

resource.title: National Library of Medicine (NLM) DTDs
resource.shortDesc: XML DTDs for exchanging content between publishers and NLM
resource.longDesc: A suite of tag sets for authoring and archiving journal articles as well as transferring journal articles from publishers to archives and between archives. There are four tag sets: Archiving and Interchange Tag Set - Created to enable an archive to capture as many of the structural and semantic components of existing printed and tagged journal material as conveniently as possible; Journal Publishing Tag Set - Optimized for archives that wish to regularize and control their content, not to accept the sequence and arrangement presented to them by any particular publisher; Article Authoring Tag Set - Designed for authoring new journal articles; NCBI Book Tag Set - Written specifically to describe volumes for the NCBI online libraries.

resource.title: NCBI C++ Toolkit Manual
resource.shortDesc: Searchable documentation of the NCBI C++ software library
resource.longDesc: A comprehensive manual on the NCBI C++ toolkit, including its design and development framework, a C++ library reference, software examples and demos, FAQs and release notes. The manual is searchable online and can be downloaded as a series of PDF documents.

resource.title: NCBI Data Specifications
resource.shortDesc: XML DTDs for NCBI databases
resource.longDesc: Specifications for NCBI data in ASN.1 or DTD format are available on the Index of data_specs page. The "NCBI_data_conversion.html" links to the conversion tool.

resource.title: NCBI Education Page
resource.shortDesc: Central page providing links to tutorials and training materials
resource.longDesc: Provides links to tutorials and training materials, including PowerPoint slides and print handouts.

resource.title: NCBI Glossary
resource.shortDesc: Glossary of bioinformatics terms
resource.longDesc: Part of the NCBI Handbook, this glossary contains descriptions of NCBI tools and acronyms, bioinformatics terms and data representation formats.

resource.title: NCBI Handbook
resource.shortDesc: Introductory articles about NCBI resources
resource.longDesc: An extensive collection of articles about NCBI databases and software. Designed for a novice user, each article presents a general overview of the resource and its design, along with tips for searching and using available analysis tools. All articles can be searched online and downloaded in PDF format; the handbook can be accessed through the NCBI Bookshelf.

resource.title: NCBI Help Manual
resource.shortDesc: Online, searchable help documentation
resource.longDesc: Accessed through the NCBI Bookshelf, the Help Manual contains documentation for many NCBI resources, including PubMed, PubMed Central, the Entrez system, Gene, SNP and LinkOut. All chapters can be downloaded in PDF format.

resource.title: NCBI News
resource.shortDesc: NCBI's monthly newsletter
resource.longDesc: NCBI's monthly newsletter that provides information on new and updated databases, and software services. The News often has feature articles that highlight and demonstrate services, features, tools, and interesting data with practical examples of their use.

resource.title: NCBI Toolbox
resource.shortDesc: The NCBI C/C++ software library
resource.longDesc: A set of software and data exchange specifications used by NCBI to produce portable, modular software for molecular biology. The software in the Toolbox is primarily designed to read records in Abstract Syntax Notation 1 (ASN.1) format, an International Standards Organization (ISO) data representation format.

resource.title: NCBI Website Search
resource.shortDesc: Search NCBI Web site for static content, documentation, and tools.
resource.longDesc: A database of static NCBI web pages, documentation, and online tools. These pages include such content as specialized online sequence analysis tools, back issues of newsletters, legacy resource description pages, sample code, and other miscellaneous resources. Searching this database is equivalent to a site search tool for the whole NCBI web site, with the exception of the FTP directories.

resource.title: NIH Manuscript Submissions (NIHMS)
resource.shortDesc: NIH-funded manuscript submission system.
resource.longDesc: The NIH Manuscript Submission (NIHMS) System is used to submit manuscripts that arise from NIH funding to the PubMed Central digital archive, in accordance with the NIH Public Access Policy and the law it implements. The law and Public Access Policy are intended to ensure that the public has access to the published results of NIH-funded research.

resource.title: Nucleotide Database
resource.shortDesc: Nucleotide sequence data in GenBank and RefSeq
resource.longDesc: A collection of nucleotide sequences from several sources, including GenBank, RefSeq, the Third Party Annotation (TPA) database, and PDB. Searching the Nucleotide Database will yield available results from each of its component databases.

resource.title: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Animals (OMIA)
resource.shortDesc: Database of genetic disorders in non-human animals
resource.longDesc: A database of genes, inherited disorders and traits in animal species (other than human and mouse), with textual information and references, as well as links to relevant records from other NCBI databases, such as PubMed and Gene.

resource.title: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM)
resource.shortDesc: Database of human genes and genetic disorders
resource.longDesc: A database of human genes and genetic disorders. NCBI maintains current content and continues to support its searching and integration with other NCBI databases. However, OMIM now has a new home at omim.org, and users are directed to this site for full record displays.

resource.title: Open Mass Spectrometry Search Algorithm (OMSSA) Search
resource.shortDesc: Matches mass spectra of peptides to proteins at NCBI
resource.longDesc: An efficient search engine for identifying MS/MS peptide spectra by searching libraries of known protein sequences. OMSSA scores significant hits with a probability score developed using classical hypothesis testing, the same statistical method used in BLAST.

resource.title: Open Reading Frame Finder (ORF Finder)
resource.shortDesc: Tool for finding open reading frames in a query sequence
resource.longDesc: A graphical analysis tool that finds all open reading frames in a user's sequence or in a sequence already in the database. Sixteen different genetic codes can be used. The deduced amino acid sequence can be saved in various formats and searched against protein databases using BLAST.

resource.title: OSIRIS
resource.shortDesc: A public domain quality assurance software package that facilitates the assessment of multiplex short tandem repeat (STR) DNA profiles based on laboratory-specific protocols.
resource.longDesc: A public domain quality assurance software package that facilitates the assessment of multiplex short tandem repeat (STR) DNA profiles based on laboratory-specific protocols. OSIRIS evaluates the raw electrophoresis data using an independently derived mathematically-based sizing algorithm. It offers two new peak quality measures - fit level and sizing residual. It can be customized to accommodate laboratory-specific signatures such as background noise settings, customized naming conventions and additional internal laboratory controls.

resource.title: Phenotype-Genotype Integrator (PheGenI)
resource.shortDesc: Human phenotype-genotype relationships
resource.longDesc: Supports finding human phenotype/genotype relationships with queries by phenotype, chromosome location, gene, and SNP identifiers. Currently includes information from dbGaP, the NHGRI GWAS Catalog, and GTeX. Displays results on the genome, on sequence, or in tables for download.

resource.title: PopSet
resource.shortDesc: Sets of nucleotide sequences representing a population
resource.longDesc: Database of related DNA sequences that originate from comparative studies: phylogenetic, population, environmental and, to a lesser degree, mutational. Each record in the database is a set of DNA sequences. For example, a population set provides information on genetic variation within an organism, while a phylogenetic set may contain sequences, and their alignment, of a single gene obtained from several related organisms.

resource.title: Primer-BLAST
resource.shortDesc: Designs PCR primers and analyzes them for target specificity using BLAST.
resource.longDesc: The Primer-BLAST tool uses Primer3 to design PCR primers to a sequence template. The potential products are then automatically analyzed with a BLAST search against user specified databases, to check the specificity to the target intended.

resource.title: Probe
resource.shortDesc: Nucleotide reagents used in genotyping, gene expression and gene silencing
resource.longDesc: A public registry of nucleic acid reagents designed for use in a wide variety of biomedical research applications, together with information on reagent distributors, probe effectiveness, and computed sequence similarities.

resource.title: ProSplign
resource.shortDesc: Tool for aligning proteins to genomic DNA
resource.longDesc: A utility for computing alignment of proteins to genomic nucleotide sequence. It is based on a variation of the Needleman Wunsch global alignment algorithm and specifically accounts for introns and splice signals. Due to this algorithm, ProSplign is accurate in determining splice sites and tolerant to sequencing errors.

resource.title: Protein Clusters
resource.shortDesc: Clusters of related proteins from prokaryotes and organelles
resource.longDesc: A collection of related protein sequences (clusters), consisting of Reference Sequence proteins encoded by complete prokaryotic and organelle plasmids and genomes. The database provides easy access to annotation information, publications, domains, structures, external links, and analysis tools.

resource.title: Protein Database
resource.shortDesc: Protein sequence data
resource.longDesc: A database that includes protein sequence records from a variety of sources, including GenPept, RefSeq, Swiss-Prot, PIR, PRF, and PDB.

resource.title: PSSM Viewer
resource.shortDesc: Tool that displays and manipulates position-specific score matrices
resource.longDesc: Allows users to display, sort, subset and download position-specific score matrices (PSSMs) either from CDD records or from Position Specific Iterated (PSI)-BLAST protein searches. The tool also can align a query protein to the PSSM and highlight positions of high conservation.

resource.title: PubChem BioAssay
resource.shortDesc: Contributed bioactivity data for PubChem Substances
resource.longDesc: Consists of deposited bioactivity data and descriptions of bioactivity assays used to screen the chemical substances contained in the PubChem Substance database, including descriptions of the conditions and the readouts (bioactivity levels) specific to the screening procedure.

resource.title: PubChem Compound
resource.shortDesc: Unique, standardized chemical structures
resource.longDesc: Contains unique, validated chemical structures (small molecules) that can be searched using names, synonyms or keywords. The compound records may link to more than one PubChem Substance record if different depositors supplied the same structure. These Compound records reflect validated chemical depiction information provided to describe substances in PubChem Substance. Structures stored within PubChem Compounds are pre-clustered and cross-referenced by identity and similarity groups. Additionally, calculated properties and descriptors are available for searching and filtering of chemical structures.

resource.title: PubChem Deposition Gateway
resource.shortDesc: Deposit data to PubChem Substance and Bioassay
resource.longDesc: This site is for users who want to contribute new data to PubChem and/or test data upload procedures. Contributors first create a test account where they can test the deposition procedures and preview their data records. They may then proceed to a deposition account whereby their data will be uploaded into the public database.

resource.title: PubChem Download Service
resource.shortDesc: Web facility for downloading PubChem Compound and Substance data
resource.longDesc: This service allows users to download compound or substance records corresponding to a set of PubChem identifiers, which can be supplied manually or through a text file. Numerous download formats are available, including SDF, XML and SMILES.

resource.title: PubChem Power User Gateway (PUG)
resource.shortDesc: PubChem API for downloads and structure searches
resource.longDesc: PUG provides access to PubChem services via a programmatic interface. PUG allows users to download data, initiate chemical structure searches, standardize chemical structures and interact with the E-utilities. PUG can be accessed using either standard URLs or via SOAP.

resource.title: PubChem Standardization Service
resource.shortDesc: Preview a substance's standardized structure
resource.longDesc: Standardization, in PubChem terminology, is the processing of chemical structures in the same way used to create PubChem Compound records from contributors' original structures. This service lets users see how PubChem would handle any structure they would like to submit.

resource.title: PubChem Structure Search
resource.shortDesc: Searches PubChem Compound by chemical structure
resource.longDesc: PubChem Structure Search allows the PubChem Compound Database to be queried by chemical structure or chemical structure pattern. The PubChem Sketcher allows a query to be drawn manually. Users may also specify the structural query input by PubChem Compound Identifier (CID), SMILES, SMARTS, InChI, Molecular Formula, or by upload of a supported structure file format.

resource.title: PubChem Substance
resource.shortDesc: Provides information on the biological activities of small molecules.
resource.longDesc: PubChem Substance records contain substance information electronically submitted to PubChem by depositors. This includes any chemical structure information submitted, as well as chemical names, comments, and links to the depositor's web site.

resource.title: PubMed
resource.shortDesc: Biomedical literature abstracts
resource.longDesc: A database of citations and abstracts for biomedical literature from MEDLINE and additional life science journals. Links are provided when full text versions of the articles are available via PubMed Central (described below) or other websites.

resource.title: PubMed Central (PMC)
resource.shortDesc: Free, full-text articles
resource.longDesc: A digital archive of full-text biomedical and life sciences journal literature, including clinical medicine and public health.

resource.title: PubMed Central (PMC) Open-Access Subset
resource.shortDesc: Collection of PubMed Central articles available for downloading
resource.longDesc: The PMC Open-Access Subset is a relatively small part of the total collection of articles in PMC. Whereas the majority of articles in PMC are subject to traditional copyright restrictions, these articles are protected by copyright, but are made available under a Creative Commons or similar license that generally allows more liberal redistribution and reuse than a traditional copyright. Please refer to the license statement in each article for specific terms of use.

resource.title: PubMed Clinical Queries
resource.shortDesc: Directory of PubMed queries about clinical topics
resource.longDesc: A specialized PubMed search form targeted to clinicians and health services researchers. The page simplifies searching by clinical study category, finding systematic reviews and searching the medical genetics literature.

resource.title: PubMed Health
resource.shortDesc: clinical effectiveness reviews to help interpret clinical research results
resource.longDesc: A collection of clinical effectiveness reviews and other resources to help consumers and clinicians use and understand clinical research results. These are drawn from the NCBI Bookshelf and PubMed, including published systematic reviews from organizations such as the Agency for Health Care Research and Quality, The Cochrane Collaboration, and others (see complete listing). Links to full text articles are provided when available.

resource.title: PubMed Tutorials
resource.shortDesc: Online tutorials on using PubMed, Entrez and MyNCBI
resource.longDesc: A collection of web and flash tutorials on PubMed searching and linking, saving searches in MyNCBI, using MeSH and other PubMed services.

resource.title: Reference Sequence (RefSeq)
resource.shortDesc: Curated nucleotide and protein sequences produced by NCBI
resource.longDesc: A collection of curated, non-redundant genomic DNA, transcript (RNA), and protein sequences produced by NCBI. RefSeqs provide a stable reference for genome annotation, gene identification and characterization, mutation and polymorphism analysis, expression studies, and comparative analyses. The RefSeq collection is accessed through the Nucleotide and Protein databases.

resource.title: RefSeqGene
resource.shortDesc: RefSeqGene reference standards for genomic sequences of well-characterized genes
resource.longDesc: A collection of human gene-specific reference genomic sequences. RefSeq gene is a subset of NCBI’s RefSeq database, and are defined based on review from curators of locus-specific databases and the genetic testing community. They form a stable foundation for reporting mutations, for establishing consistent intron and exon numbering conventions, and for defining the coordinates of other biologically significant variation. RefSeqGene is a part of the Locus Reference Genomic (LRG) Collaboration.

resource.title: Related Structures
resource.shortDesc: find 3D structures from the Molecular Modeling Database (MMDB) that are similar in sequence to a query protein.
resource.longDesc: The Related Structures tool allows users to find 3D structures from the Molecular Modeling Database (MMDB) that are similar in sequence to a query protein. Although the query protein may not yet have a resolved structure, the 3D shape of a similar protein sequence can shed light on the putative shape and biological function of the query protein.

resource.title: Retrovirus Resources
resource.shortDesc: Tools, maps, and sequence for retroviruses.
resource.longDesc: A collection of resources specifically designed to support the research of retroviruses, including a genotyping tool that uses the BLAST algorithm to identify the genotype of a query sequence; an alignment tool for global alignment of multiple sequences; an HIV-1 automatic sequence annotation tool; and annotated maps of numerous retroviruses viewable in GenBank, FASTA, and graphic formats, with links to associated sequence records.

resource.title: RSS Feeds
resource.shortDesc: RSS feeds available from NCBI
resource.longDesc: Subscribe to Web/RSS feeds for updates about NCBI resources.

resource.title: SARS CoV
resource.shortDesc: Data for the SARS coronavirus.
resource.longDesc: A summary of data for the SARS coronavirus (CoV), including links to the most recent sequence data and publications, links to other SARS related resources, and a pre-computed alignment of genome sequences from various isolates.

resource.title: Science Primer
resource.shortDesc: An introduction to bioinformatics at NCBI
resource.longDesc: A basic introduction to the science and technology that underlies many of the NCBI resources. A great starting place for students and the general public, the Science Primer provides a basis for understanding the NCBI web site and mission, and provides direct links to many NCBI databases and tools. Topics include genome mapping, molecular modeling, mutations, microarrays (gene expression), genetics, pharmacogenomics (personalized medicine) and phylogenetics (evolutionary relationships).

resource.title: Sequence Read Archive (SRA)
resource.shortDesc: Database of sequences reads from next generation sequencing technologies
resource.longDesc: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA) stores sequencing data from the next generation of sequencing platforms including Roche 454 GS System®, Illumina Genome Analyzer®, Life Technologies AB SOLiD System®, Helicos Biosciences Heliscope®, Complete Genomics®, and Pacific Biosciences SMRT®.

resource.title: Sequence Read Archive Submission
resource.shortDesc: SRA submission guidelines.
resource.longDesc: This link describes how submitters of SRA data can obtain a secure NCBI FTP site for their data, and also describes the allowed data formats and directory structures.

resource.title: Sequence Viewer
resource.shortDesc: An interactive, online display format for sequences, with an embeddable web version available.
resource.longDesc: Provides a configurable graphical display of a nucleotide or protein sequence and features that have been annotated on that sequence. In addition to use on NCBI sequence database pages, this viewer is available as an embeddable webpage component. Detailed documentation including an API Reference guide is available for developers wishing to embed the viewer in their own pages.

resource.title: SNP Database Specialized Search Tools
resource.shortDesc: Set of custom tools for locating SNPs
resource.longDesc: A variety of tools are available for searching the SNP database, allowing search by genotype, method, population, submitter, markers and sequence similarity using BLAST. These are linked under ""Search"" on the left side bar of the dbSNP main page.

resource.title: SNP Submission Tool
resource.shortDesc: The SNP database tools page provides links to the general submission guidelines and to the submission handle request.
resource.longDesc: The SNP database tools page provides links to the general submission guidelines and to the submission handle request. The page has also two specific links for single- or batch submissions of the human variation data using Human Genome Variation Society nomenclature.

resource.title: Splign
resource.shortDesc: Tool for aligning transcripts to genomic DNA
resource.longDesc: A utility for computing cDNA-to-Genomic sequence alignments. It is based on a variation of the Needleman-Wunsch global alignment algorithm and specifically accounts for introns and splice signals. Due to this algorithm, Splign is accurate in determining splice sites and tolerant to sequencing errors.

resource.title: Structure (Molecular Modeling Database)
resource.shortDesc: Database of 3D macromolecular structures derived from PDB
resource.longDesc: Contains macromolecular 3D structures derived from the Protein Data Bank, as well as tools for their visualization and comparative analysis.

resource.title: Submission Portal
resource.shortDesc: NCBI-wide submission portal
resource.longDesc: A single entry point for submitters to link to and find information about all of the data submission processes at NCBI. Currently, this serves as an interface for the registration of BioProjects and BioSamples and submission of data for WGS and GTR. Future additions to this site are planned.

resource.title: Taxonomy
resource.shortDesc: The NCBI taxonomy tree in Entrez
resource.longDesc: Contains the names and phylogenetic lineages of more than 160,000 organisms that have molecular data in the NCBI databases. New taxa are added to the Taxonomy database as data are deposited for them.

resource.title: Taxonomy Browser
resource.shortDesc: Displays and links Entrez data to each taxonomic node
resource.longDesc: Supports searching the taxonomy tree using partial taxonomic names, common names, wild cards and phonetically similar names. For each taxonomic node, the tool provides links to all data in Entrez for that node, displays the lineage, and provides links to external sites related to the node.

resource.title: Taxonomy Common Tree
resource.shortDesc: Creates custom taxonomic trees
resource.longDesc: Generates a taxonomic tree for a selected group of organisms. Users can upload a file of taxonomy IDs or names, or they can enter names or IDs directly.

resource.title: Taxonomy Statistics
resource.shortDesc: Displays statistics related to the Taxonomy database
resource.longDesc: Displays the number of taxonomic nodes in the database for a given rank and date of inclusion.

resource.title: Taxonomy Status Reports
resource.shortDesc: Displays the status of a taxonomy ID
resource.longDesc: Displays the current status of a set of taxonomic nodes or IDs.

resource.title: TaxPlot
resource.shortDesc: Tool to Compare three genomes based on protein homologs
resource.longDesc: A tool for comparing genomes on the basis of the protein sequences they encode. To use TaxPlot, one selects a reference genome and two species for comparison. Pre-computed BLAST results are then used to plot a point for each predicted protein in the reference genome, based on the best alignment with proteins in each of the two genomes being compared.

resource.title: Third Party Annotation (TPA) Database
resource.shortDesc: Sequence annotations submitted for sequences already in GenBank
resource.longDesc: A database that contains sequences built from the existing primary sequence data in GenBank. The sequences and corresponding annotations are experimentally supported and have been published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. TPA records are retrieved through the Nucleotide Database.

resource.title: Trace Archive
resource.shortDesc: DNA chromatograms, base calls, and quality estimates for single-pass reads.
resource.longDesc: A repository of DNA sequence chromatograms (traces), base calls, and quality estimates for single-pass reads from various large-scale sequencing projects.

resource.title: Trace Archive Submission
resource.shortDesc: Trace submission information.
resource.longDesc: This link describes how submitters of trace data can obtain a secure NCBI FTP site for their data, and also describes the allowed data formats and directory structures.

resource.title: UniGene
resource.shortDesc: Gene-centered clusters of transcripts and ESTs
resource.longDesc: A database that provides sets of transcript sequences that appear to come from the same transcription locus (gene or expressed pseudogene), together with information on protein similarities, gene expression, cDNA clone reagents, and genomic location.

resource.title: UniGene Library Browser
resource.shortDesc: Collection of EST libraries in UniGene
resource.longDesc: This database contains libraries of Expressed Sequence Tags (ESTs) organized by organism, tissue type and developmental stage.

resource.title: UniSTS
resource.shortDesc: Database of Sequence Tagged Sites
resource.longDesc: A comprehensive database of sequence tagged sites (STSs) derived from STS-based maps and other experiments. STSs are defined by PCR primer pairs and are associated with additional information, such as genomic position, genes, and sequences.

resource.title: Variation Reporter
resource.shortDesc: A report generator for information about human variations by sequence location and allele
resource.longDesc: A tool designed to search for and report human sequence variation data from dbSNP and dbVar. Individual variations or batch files can be submitted in HGVS, GVF or BED formats. Related information will be retrieved and reported in a downloadable table containing variation identifiers, nucleotide and cytogenetic band locations on various genomic assemblies, allele type and minor allele frequencies, predicted functional consequences (missense, nonsense, frameshift, splice site, etc.), reported clinical significance, and relevant citations.

resource.title: VecScreen
resource.shortDesc: Tool for detecting vector contamination
resource.longDesc: A system for quickly identifying segments of a nucleic acid sequence that may be of vector origin. VecScreen searches a query sequence for segments that match any sequence in a specialized non-redundant vector database (UniVec).

resource.title: Vector Alignment Search Tool (VAST)
resource.shortDesc: Tool that generates 3D structural alignments
resource.longDesc: A computer algorithm that identifies similar protein 3-dimensional structures. Structure neighbors for every structure in MMDB are pre-computed and accessible via links on the MMDB Structure Summary pages. These neighbors can be used to identify distant homologs that cannot be recognized by sequence comparison alone.

resource.title: Viral Genomes
resource.shortDesc: Comprehensive collection of viral resources.
resource.longDesc: A wide range of resources, including a brief summary of the biology of viruses, links to viral genome sequences in Entrez Genome, and information about viral Reference Sequences, a collection of reference sequences for thousands of viral genomes.

resource.title: Viral Genotyping Tool
resource.shortDesc: Tool for identifying viral genotypes using BLAST
resource.longDesc: This tool helps identify the genotype of a viral sequence. A window is slid along the query sequence and each window is compared by BLAST to each of the reference sequences for a particular virus.

resource.title: Virus Variation
resource.shortDesc: Data and tools for selected viruses.
resource.longDesc: An extension of the Influenza Virus Resource to other organisms, providing an interface to download sequence sets of selected viruses, analysis tools, including virus-specific BLAST pages, and genome annotation pipelines.
